channel.title: Sel i/fp parameters on parent behaviour
channel.description: Not sure if this is intended but it makes using these objects in sub-patches somewhat awkward. To me it would make more sense to take the row of parameters as a whole (like the sel b objects). Since you can use dials for single fractionals. Edit: not sure why discourse decides to do that to my image, click for full length.

item.title: Sel i/fp parameters on parent behaviour
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

I too have run into this issue and it makes no sense to me. I can only assume that is not deliberate and just a bug caused by the way the patcher normally handles parameter on parent automatically. I guess at some point they'll add an exception for these.

Read full topic
item.source: Sel i/fp parameters on parent behaviour

item.title: Sel i/fp parameters on parent behaviour
item.dc:creator: @hellcore
item.description:
@hellcore wrote:

Not sure if this is intended but it makes using these objects in sub-patches somewhat awkward.

Screenshot 2016-06-13 13.09.12.png398x782 19.7 KB

To me it would make more sense to take the row of parameters as a whole (like the sel b objects). Since you can use dials for single fractionals.

Edit: not sure why discourse decides to do that to my image, click for full length.

Read full topic
item.source: Sel i/fp parameters on parent behaviour
